subject: History
content:
1. Who was King Jaja of Opobo? a) A famous writer b) A great leader and warrior of Opobo c) A famous singer

2. Where was King Jaja of Opobo from? a) Lagos b) Opobo c) Zaria

3. What was King Jaja of Opobo known for? a) Trading and making Opobo a rich city b) Writing books c) Becoming a teacher

4. What was Oba Ovonranwen known for? a) His role in defending Benin against invaders b) Being a famous athlete c) Writing songs

5. Where did Oba Ovonranwen rule? a) Opobo b) Benin c) Zaria

6. Why was Oba Ovonranwen important to the Benin Kingdom? a) He helped build bridges b) He fought to protect his kingdom during the British invasion c) He taught people how to farm

7. Who was Chief Nana of Itsekiri? a) A famous scientist b) A wealthy and powerful leader of the Itsekiri people c) A popular singer

8. Where did Chief Nana of Itsekiri rule? a) Opobo b) Itsekiri c) Zaria

9. What was Chief Nana of Itsekiri known for? a) His bravery in the fight against British forces b) His art skills c) His ability to sing

10. Who was Queen Aminat of Zaria? a) A famous leader who ruled the Kingdom of Zaria b) A famous teacher c) A well-known musician

11. What is Queen Aminat of Zaria famous for? a) Being a warrior who expanded the Kingdom of Zaria b) Building schools c) Writing books

12. Where did Queen Aminat of Zaria rule? a) Opobo b) Zaria c) Benin

13. What did Queen Aminat of Zaria do during her reign? a) She fought battles to protect her kingdom b) She built bridges c) She traveled around the world

14. Which hero helped in the defense of the Benin Kingdom against the British? a) King Jaja b) Chief Nana c) Oba Ovonranwen

15. What was one of the challenges King Jaja of Opobo faced? a) Fighting invaders b) Being exiled by the British c) Building a new city

16. What did Chief Nana of Itsekiri do after fighting the British? a) He became a teacher b) He moved to another country c) He went into exile

17. Which of these heroes or heroines fought to protect their land from foreign invasion? a) Queen Aminat b) Chief Nana c) All of the above

18. How did Queen Aminat of Zaria help her people? a) By leading successful military campaigns b) By creating art c) By planting trees

19. What did King Jaja of Opobo help his people with? a) Developing the trade business b) Building schools c) Writing history books

20. Which of the following heroes was a leader of the Itsekiri people? a) Chief Nana b) Queen Aminat c) Oba Ovonrowen

21. Where do the Nupe people mostly live? a) In the southeastern part of Nigeria b) In the central part of Nigeria c) In the northern part of Nigeria

22. What language do the Nupe people speak? a) Hausa b) Nupe c) Yoruba

23. The Nupe people are known for which traditional activity? a) Weaving and making pottery b) Farming and fishing c) Writing books

24. What is the capital of the Nupe people’s region? a) Lokoja b) Minna c) Kaduna

25. Which of these is a common food among the Nupe people? a) Pounded yam and soup b) Fufu and egusi c) Tuwo and vegetable soup

26. Where do the Jukun people live? a) In the southern part of Nigeria b) In the northeastern part of Nigeria c) In the central and northeastern parts of Nigeria

27. What language do the Jukun people speak? a) Jukun b) Kanuri c) Igbo

28. Which of these is a traditional Jukun dance? a) Argungu b) Waza c) Jukun traditional dance

29. What is the Jukun people’s main occupation? a) Fishing and farming b) Hunting and gathering c) Trading and weaving

30. Which state is home to many Jukun people? a) Kogi State b) Taraba State c) Ogun State

31. What is the traditional attire of the Gbagyi people? a) Brightly colored robes b) Simple, local fabric wraps c) Animal skins

32. The Gbagyi people are known for living in which region of Nigeria? a) The southwestern region b) The central region c) The southeastern region

33. What language do the Gbagyi people speak? a) Gbagyi b) Yoruba c) Ibo

34. What is the main food of the Gbagyi people? a) Rice and beans b) Yam and cassava c) Noodles and soup

35. What is a traditional Gbagyi festival? a) Durbar Festival b) Ngu Festival c) Argungu Festival

36. The Gbagyi people are also known for what? a) Excellent farming skills b) Pottery making c) Weaving traditional clothes

37. Which of these is a major source of income for the Nupe people? a) Fishing b) Hunting c) Trading and farming

38. What kind of houses do the Jukun people live in? a) Mud huts and houses with thatched roofs b) Tall skyscrapers c) Wooden houses with roofs made of metal

39. Which of the following is a well-known festival of the Gbagyi people? a) Sallah b) Ngu Festival c) Owu Festival

40. What is a traditional item that the Nupe people are known for making? a) Wooden masks b) Pottery and woven baskets c) Metal swords

FILL IN THE BLANKS

1. King Jaja of Opobo was originally born with the name ________.
2. King Jaja of Opobo was known for his strong leadership in the ________ trade.
3. King Jaja founded the town of ________ in the Niger Delta region.
4. Queen Amina was a famous warrior queen from the ancient kingdom of ________.
5. Queen Amina is famous for building strong ________ to protect her kingdom.

subject: National Values
content:
1. What is a citizen? a) Someone who lives in another country b) Someone who is part of a community or country c) Someone who has a pet

2. How can someone become a citizen of a country? a) By being born in that country or through legal processes b) By visiting the country c) By wearing a country’s flag

3. Which of the following is a responsibility of a good citizen? a) Paying taxes b) Ignoring rules c) Disrespecting others

4. What does it mean to be a responsible citizen? a) Following the rules and helping the community b) Playing all day long c) Avoiding school

5. Why is it important to respect the laws of a country? a) To help the country stay safe and organized b) To make life more difficult c) To avoid getting beating

6. Which of these is a right of a citizen? a) The right to vote b) The right to take other people’s property c) The right to skip school whenever you want

7. What is the right to vote? a) The right to choose leaders in the country b) The right to take a day off work c) The right to travel without any rules

8. Which of these is a right that children have? a) The right to work full-time jobs b) The right to go to school and get an education c) The right to make their own rules at school

9. What is the right to freedom of speech? a) The right to say whatever you want, anytime b) The right to express your thoughts and opinions freely c) The right to shout at others

10. Why do citizens have the right to own property? a) To be able to travel b) To have their own house or land c) To be able to throw away.

11. What is a local government? a) A government in a foreign country b) The people who make decisions for a town or city c) The leaders of a school

12. What is one responsibility of the local government? a) Deciding what people wear b) Making sure there are roads and schools in the community c) Deciding the weather

13. Who is usually in charge of the local government? a) The president b) The mayor or council members c) Teachers

14. What do local governments do to keep the community clean? a) They collect trash and recycle b) They teach people to ignore cleanliness c) They make more trash

15. What is a town meeting? a) A time when people talk about the weather b) A gathering where citizens discuss local issues and make decisions c) A place to eat food together

16. Why is it important to have local governments? a) They help solve problems in the community and make it better b) They play games with people c) They control everyone’s life

17. Who can help make decisions in a local government? a) Only children b) Only people with lots of money c) Citizens who vote and elected leaders

18. What do local governments use taxes for? a) To buy candy for everyone b) To build roads, schools, and parks c) To create new laws that don't help people

19. Which of these might a local government do to help the community? a) Fix broken roads b) Ignore problems in the town c) Tell people not to work

20. How can you participate in your local government? a) By voting when you are old enough and sharing your ideas b) By staying home and doing nothing c) By ignoring rules

21. What is the main purpose of a government? a) To make laws and keep order b) To build roads c) To entertain people

22. What is the government responsible for? a) Making and enforcing laws b) Cooking food for people c) Watching TV

23. Who leads the executive branch of the Nigerian government? a) The President b) The Speaker of the House c) The Chief Justice

24. What is the role of the legislative branch? a) To carry out laws b) To make laws c) To interpret laws

25. Which of these is part of the legislative branch of government? a) The President b) The Senate and the House of Representatives c) The Supreme Court

26. What does the judicial branch do? a) Enforces laws b) Makes laws c) Interprets laws and makes sure they are fair

27. Who interprets the laws in the judicial branch? a) The President b) The Judges c) The Governors

28. Which of these is a duty of the state government? a) Running national elections b) Making laws about local schools c) Printing money

29. Who is in charge of the state government? a) The President b) The Governor c) The Speaker of the House

30. What is one thing that the state government does? a) Builds the White House b) Creates rules for schools and public safety c) Controls the army

31. What do we call the system where power is shared between the state and national governments? a) Democracy b) Federalism c) Monarchy

32. Which branch of government helps make laws? a) Judicial b) Legislative c) Executive

33. Which branch of government enforces the laws? a) Executive b) Legislative c) Judicial

34. Who is part of the state government? a) The President b) The Governor and state legislators c) The Supreme Court

35. What is a responsibility of the local government? a) Making national laws b) Managing police and fire departments c) Running the military

36. What is a major duty of the state government? a) Making laws about schools and public health b) Deciding what movies to watch c) Deciding the price of food

37. Who helps the President enforce laws? a) The Governor b) The President’s helpers c) The police and military

38. Which branch of government does the President belong to? a) Judicial b) Legislative c) Executive

39. What is one duty of the judicial branch? a) To make laws b) To interpret the laws c) To help build roads

40. What is an example of a state government job? a) Deciding national tax rates b) Running state parks c) Deciding foreign policy

FILL IN THE BLANKS

1. A person who is a member of a country and has the right to live there is called a _______.
2. One of the most important rights of a citizen is the right to _______ in elections.
3. Citizens have the right to _______ for jobs and work in their country.
4. A citizen has the responsibility to _______ the laws of their country.
5. A citizen has the right to _______ an education and attend school.

subject: English Language
content:
Grammar
1. Which sentence is correct? a) She are going to the store. b) She is going to the store. c) She going to the store.
2. Which word is a noun? a) Run b) Happy c) Dog
3. Choose the correct verb: "He ____ to school every day." a) Goes b) Going c) Went
4. Which of the following sentences is in past tense? a) I am playing with my friend. b) I played with my friend. c) I will play with my friend.
5. Which of these is a complete sentence? a) Because she was tired. b) She went home because she was tired. c) Went home she was tired.

Reading
6. What is the main idea of a story? a) The characters’ names b) What the story is mostly about c) The places in the story
7. If you are reading a story about a boy who loves to play soccer, what is the likely theme? a) Cooking b) Sports and teamwork c) Going to the zoo
8. What does "plot" mean in a story? a) The name of the characters b) The sequence of events in the story c) The lesson learned in the story
9. What is a good strategy for understanding a difficult text? a) Skip all the words you don’t know b) Read the text slowly and look up unfamiliar words c) Close the book when it gets hard
10. Which of these would be a good title for a story about a dog and its adventures? a) "The Dog Who Traveled the World" b) "The History of Dogs" c) "How to Build a House"

Vocabulary
11. What does the word "gigantic" mean? a) Very small b) Very large c) Very soft
12. Which word is a synonym for "happy"? a) Sad b) Excited c) Angry
13. Which word is an antonym for "slow"? a) Fast b) Quiet c) Tall
14. If you describe something as "smooth," it means it is: a) Rough and bumpy b) Soft and soft to touch c) Even and flat
15. Which of these words means “to look carefully”? a) Stare b) Glance c) Blink

Listening

16. If someone says, “Listen carefully,” what should you do? a) Ignore them b) Pay attention and focus on what they are saying c) Start talking loudly
17. What should you do when listening to a story? a) Look around the room b) Focus on the speaker and understand the story c) Start writing your own
18. If you don’t understand what someone says, what should you do? a) Ignore them b) Ask them to repeat or explain c) Walk away
Speaking
19. Which sentence is a question? a) He is going to the park. b) Are you coming to the park? c) They play outside every day.
20. When speaking clearly, what should you do? a) Talk quickly and mumble
b) Speak slowly and make sure your words are clear
c) Whisper.

21. Which one is a verb? a) House
b) Run
c) Apple



22. Choose the correct verb for this sentence: "She _______ to school every day." a) Go
b) Going
c) Goes



23. What is the past tense of "eat"? a) Eating
b) Eats
c) Ate



24. Which word is a verb in this sentence: "The dog barks loudly." a) Dog
b) Loudly
c) Barks



25. Fill in the blank: "I _______ my homework yesterday." a) Do
b) Doing
c) Did



26. Choose the verb in the sentence: "Tommy plays football on weekends." a) Tommy
b) Plays
c) Weekend


27. Which sentence uses a verb correctly? a) She play the piano.
b) She playing the piano.
c) She plays the piano.



28. Which verb completes the sentence? "We _______ to the park now." a) Going
b) Goes
c) Are going



29. Which of these is an action verb? a) Blue
b) Jump
c) Apple



30. Which word is a verb in the sentence: "He talks to his friend every day." a) Talks
b) He
c) Friend






31. (Teacher says: "The cat jumps over the fence.") What did the cat do? a) Runs
b) Jumps
c) Sits



32. (Teacher says: "I will help you with your homework.") What will the teacher do? a) Teach
b) Help
c) Talk



33. (Teacher says: "The dog is barking loudly.") What is the dog doing? a) Sleeping
b) Barking
c) Running


34. (Teacher says: "We are eating lunch right now.") What are they doing? a) Playing
b) Eating
c) Singing



35. (Teacher says: "She is reading a book.") What is she doing? a) Running
b) Reading
c) Sleeping


36. Choose the correct verb: "They _______ to the movie theater." a) Go
b) Goes
c) Going



37. What word completes the sentence? "I _______ my bicycle to school." a) Ride
b) Rides
c) Riding



38. Choose the correct verb form: "He _______ his homework every day." a) Do
b) Does
c) Did


39. Which sentence is correct? a) They is playing soccer.
b) They are play soccer.
c) They are playing soccer


40. What is the correct verb for this sentence? "We _______ to the beach last weekend." a) Went
b) Going
c) Goes

2. She bought some _______ (rice/rices) for dinner.
3. There are five _______ (dog/dogs) in the park.
4. Can I have a little _______ (water/waters) to drink?
5. We need a few _______ (book/books) for the classroom.
